About InstallApplication
The InstallApplication is used to install .jar/.ear./war files to WebSphere
Running InstallApplication from commandline
Running the InstallApplication task from the commandline is done using the following syntax (start the server first, optional parameters omitted):
mvn was5:StartServer was5:InstallApplication \ -DwasHome=<path to websphere> \ -Dear=target/myejbs-2.1.jar
Running InstallApplication with definition in pom
Running the InstallApplication task with the definition defined in the build section of the pom (start the server first, optional parameters omitted):
<dependencies> <dependency> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <scope>runtime</scope> </dependency> </dependencies>
<build> <plugins> <plugin> <groupId>org.codehaus.mojo</groupId> <artifactId>was5-plugin</artifactId> <version>1.0</version> <executions> <execution> <id>start server</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>StartServer</goal> </goals> </execution> <execution> <id>install application</id> <phase>pre-integration-test</phase> <goals> <goal>InstallApplication</goal> </goals> </execution> </executions> <configuration> <ear> ${artifactId}-${project.version}.ear </ear> <wasHome>C:/Programfiles/WebSphere/AppServer</wasHome> </configuration> </plugin> </plugins> </build>
When running this task, WebSphere may complain, giving you a message like this:
[java] WASX7022E: Problem running command "$AdminControl invoke [$AdminApp install HostserverServiceEJB-2.1.jar] invoke [$AdminConfig save]" -- exception i nformation: com.ibm.ws.scripting.ScriptingException: WASX7025E: Error found in S tring ""; cannot create ObjectName.
This message can safely be ignored.
